description: This trap will send when the optical transceiver is faulty.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-ETHERNET-OPTICMODULE-MIB::hwOpticsTransceiverFaultyAlarmTrap HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex i 0

description: Frame Index,the number of the frame in the device.
This table is also adopted by the case-shaped device with Agent
(For example, the MA5105).
There is no frame in this kind of device. Thus it is placed on
the rack with other devices During implementation. The frame index
is specified as 0.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex

description: Slot index that identifies the physical position of a slot.
The case-shaped device is treated as the one with only one slot whose index is always set as 0.
If there are ports in the frame, all the ports on the frame must be virtualized as
a fixed slot index (equal to the virtual slots which is the max slot index for the frame plus
1.) Their slot index is also fixedly set as 0.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex

description: Port index, the index of this table, which exclusively
determines all the ports in a subboard.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex

description: This trap will send when the Tx power of the Ethernet optical port is out of the range.

event.Summary: Ethernet optical port transmit power ($v4 dBm) out of range

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-ETHERNET-OPTICMODULE-MIB::hwOpticsPowerOutOfRangeAlarmTrap HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex i 0 HUAWEI-ETHERNET-OPTICMODULE-MIB::hwOpticsTxPower i 9999

description: Frame Index,the number of the frame in the device.
This table is also adopted by the case-shaped device with Agent
(For example, the MA5105).
There is no frame in this kind of device. Thus it is placed on
the rack with other devices During implementation. The frame index
is specified as 0.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex

description: Slot index that identifies the physical position of a slot.
The case-shaped device is treated as the one with only one slot whose index is always set as 0.
If there are ports in the frame, all the ports on the frame must be virtualized as
a fixed slot index (equal to the virtual slots which is the max slot index for the frame plus
1.) Their slot index is also fixedly set as 0.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex

description: Port index, the index of this table, which exclusively
determines all the ports in a subboard.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex

description: Transmitted power.
Unit: 0.000001dBm
variables.name: HUAWEI-ETHERNET-OPTICMODULE-MIB::hwOpticsTxPower

description: This trap will send when the temperature of the Ethernet optical port is too high.

event.Summary: Ethernet optical port temperature ($v4°C) is too high

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-ETHERNET-OPTICMODULE-MIB::hwOpticsPortTemperatureHighAlarmTrap HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwFrameIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex i 0 HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex i 0 HUAWEI-ETHERNET-OPTICMODULE-MIB::hwOpticsTemperature i 9999

description: Frame Index,the number of the frame in the device.
This table is also adopted by the case-shaped device with Agent
(For example, the MA5105).
There is no frame in this kind of device. Thus it is placed on
the rack with other devices During implementation. The frame index
is specified as 0.

The case-shaped device is treated as the one with only one slot whose index is always set as 0.
If there are ports in the frame, all the ports on the frame must be virtualized as

description: Port index, the index of this table, which exclusively
determines all the ports in a subboard.

description: Temperature.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ETHERNET-OPTICMODULE-MIB::hwOpticsTemperature
